column4: it is free cause the person that builds it has another source of income...and did this as a hobby....
and he knew he could never do it huimself, so he made all his work public...and asked others using his code to do so as well.
Linux is the kernel part, the software is GNU
and so on, goes the story.
not sure I like your story...
well why don't you improve upon it instead of complaining
I was giving a very very basic overview for someone who didn't understand why it is free
Well why don't you quit complaining and say it in an easy to understand manner so the newb can understand it
How does that matter? Linus wrote linux and so he named it
And there is more non linus / non FSF software on my computer than there is otherwise
I might try that out, thanks. Do you know what file in the gnome login starts esd?
Enlightenment has done that for years, and with pretty scroll effects
